class.name: FmodParameterDescription
class.brief_description: Describes the properties and constraints of an FMOD Studio event parameter.
class.description:
FmodParameterDescription contains metadata about an FMOD Studio event parameter, including its name, ID, value range, and behavioral properties. This information is used to properly set and validate parameter values.
Parameters in FMOD Studio can be: - Continuous (float values within a range) - Discrete (specific labeled values) - Automatic (controlled by FMOD, like distance or direction) - Global (shared across all event instances)
Parameter descriptions are obtained from [FmodEventDescription] objects and provide the information needed to: - Set parameter values correctly within their valid range - Display appropriate UI controls (sliders vs dropdowns) - Validate parameter values before setting them - Understand parameter behavior and constraints
This class is primarily used for editor tools and debugging, but can also be helpful for runtime parameter validation.

method.name: get_default_value
method.description: Returns the default value of the parameter as set in FMOD Studio.

method.name: get_id
method.description: Returns the unique numerical ID of the parameter. This ID can be used for faster parameter access compared to using the name.

method.name: get_maximum
method.description: Returns the maximum valid value for the parameter.

method.name: get_minimum
method.description: Returns the minimum valid value for the parameter.

method.name: get_name
method.description: Returns the name of the parameter as defined in FMOD Studio.

method.name: is_automatic
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the parameter is automatic (controlled by FMOD based on distance, direction, etc.) and cannot be set manually.

method.name: is_discrete
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the parameter is discrete, meaning it only accepts specific values rather than a continuous range.

method.name: is_global
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the parameter is global, meaning it's shared across all instances of the event rather than being per-instance.

method.name: is_labeled
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the parameter has labeled values (like an enum). Use [method FmodEventDescription.get_parameter_labels_by_name] to get the labels.

method.name: is_read_only
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the parameter is read-only and cannot be modified at runtime.
